title: Examples
code: df <- tidyr::tribble(  ~times, ~country,  ~gdp, ~inc,  "1990",   "A",  22.3, TRUE,  "2000",   "A",  44.6, TRUE,  "1990",   "B",  12.3, FALSE,  "2000",   "B",  4.6, FALSE  )  ggslope(df,          times = times,          outcome = gdp,          group = country)

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Graphs personal package vehicle graphs made R.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version Graphs GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows plotgraph() returns graphs made R. example, datasaurus plot.  Without input, plotgraph() function returns available graphs. use code repository.
code: library(Graphs) ## basic example code plotgraph("datasaurus.R") plotgraph() #> Error in plotgraph(): Please run `plotgraph()` with a valid argument. #> Valid examples are: #> anscombe_quartet.R #> boxplot_illustration.R #> boxplot_pitfalls.R #> data_joins.R #> datasaurus.R #> gapminder.R #> pacman.R #> simpson.R #> ucb_admission.R library(datasauRus) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(showtext) library(patchwork)  font_add_google("Amatic SC", "Amatic+SC") ## Automatically use showtext to render text for future devices showtext_auto()  #distinct(datasaurus_dozen, dataset)   dino <- filter(datasaurus_dozen, dataset == "dino" )      p1 <- ggplot(dino, aes(x = x, y = y)) +     geom_point(size = .75) +     theme(legend.position = "none") +     theme_minimal()+     theme(text=element_text(size=10,  family="Amatic+SC"))+     labs(title = "The Datasaur and some of his friends")+     theme(plot.title = element_text(size=28, face = "bold"))+     theme(strip.text.x = element_text(       size = 22, color = "black", face = "bold"     ))         datasaurus_dozen2 <- filter(datasaurus_dozen, dataset == "away" |                                 dataset == "bullseye" |                                 dataset == "circle" |                                 dataset == "dots" |                                 dataset == "star" |                                 dataset == "x_shape"    )         p2 <- ggplot(datasaurus_dozen2, aes(x = x, y = y)) +     geom_point(size = .75) +     theme(legend.position = "none") +     facet_wrap(~dataset, ncol = 2)+     theme_minimal()+     theme(text=element_text(size=10,  family="Amatic+SC"))+     theme(strip.text.x = element_text(       size = 22, color = "black", face = "bold"     ))         p1+p2

title: Make a pie chart — ggpie
text: data character vector one element. fill variable fill pie. legend default return legend.

title: Make a slope chart. — ggslope
code: ggslope(   data,   times,   outcome,   group,   color = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   linetype = NULL,   size = NULL )

title: Make a slope chart. — ggslope
text: data Data times Times outcome Outcome group Group color Color alpha Alpha linetype Linetype size Size

title: Make a slope chart. — ggslope
code: df <- tidyr::tribble( ~times, ~country,  ~gdp, ~inc, "1990",   "A",  22.3, TRUE, "2000",   "A",  44.6, TRUE, "1990",   "B",  12.3, FALSE, "2000",   "B",  4.6, FALSE ) ggslope(df,         times = times,         outcome = gdp,         group = country)
